message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing model inputs given limited access to model outputs and the ability to evaluate the model on additive perturbations to the input. This problem is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), cryptography (cs.CR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and signal processing (cs.SI). However, since the paper focuses on the use of machine learning models to solve the problem, we consider cs.LG to be the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.CV, and cs.SI.
